member.name: T:Accord.Audio.Filters.EnvelopeFilter
member.summary: Time-domain envelope detector.

remarks.para: To extract the envelope of a time-domain signal, we must first compute the absolute signal values and then pass it through a low-pass filter.

member.name: T:Accord.Audio.Filters.BaseFilter
member.summary: Base signal processing filter

member.name: T:Accord.Audio.Filters.IFilter
member.summary: Audio processing filter interface.
member.remarks: The interface defines the set of methods, which should be provided by all signal processing filters. Methods of this interface keep the source signal unchanged and returt the result of signal processing filter as new signal.

member.name: M:Accord.Audio.Filters.IFilter.Apply(Accord.Audio.Signal)
member.summary: Apply filter to an audio signal.
member.param: Source signal to apply filter to.
member.returns: Returns filter's result obtained by applying the filter to the source sample.
member.remarks: The method keeps the source sample unchanged and returns the the result of the signal processing filter as new sample.

member.name: M:Accord.Audio.Filters.IFilter.Apply(Accord.Audio.Signal[])
member.summary: Apply filter to a windowed audio signal.
member.param: Source signal to apply filter to.
member.returns: Returns filter's result obtained by applying the filter to the source sample.
member.remarks: The method keeps the source sample unchanged and returns the the result of the signal processing filter as new sample.

member.name: M:Accord.Audio.Filters.BaseFilter.Apply(Accord.Audio.Signal)
member.summary: Applies the filter to a signal.

member.name: M:Accord.Audio.Filters.BaseFilter.Apply(Accord.Audio.Signal[])
member.summary: Applies the filter to a windowed signal.

member.name: M:Accord.Audio.Filters.BaseFilter.ProcessFilter(Accord.Audio.Signal,Accord.Audio.Signal)
member.summary: Processes the filter.

member.name: P:Accord.Audio.Filters.BaseFilter.FormatTranslations
member.summary: Format translations dictionary.
member.remarks: The dictionary defines which sample formats are supported for source signals and which sample format will be used for resulting signal.

member.summary: Format translations dictionary.

member.name: T:Accord.Audio.IAudioOutput
member.summary: Audio Output Device Interface

member.name: M:Accord.Audio.IAudioOutput.Play
member.summary: Starts playing the buffer

member.name: M:Accord.Audio.IAudioOutput.Stop
member.summary: Stops playing the buffer

member.name: M:Accord.Audio.IAudioOutput.SignalToStop
member.summary: Signals audio output to stop its work.
member.remarks: Signals audio output to stop its background thread, stop to request new frames and free resources.

member.name: M:Accord.Audio.IAudioOutput.WaitForStop
member.summary: Wait until audio output has stopped.
member.remarks: Waits for audio output stopping after it was signalled to stop using method.

member.name: P:Accord.Audio.IAudioOutput.Output
member.summary: Audio output.

remarks.para: The meaning of the property depends on particular audio output. Depending on audio source it may be a file name, driver guid, URL or any other string describing the audio source.

member.name: E:Accord.Audio.IAudioOutput.FramePlayingStarted
member.summary: Indicates a block of frames have started execution.

member.name: E:Accord.Audio.IAudioOutput.Stopped
member.summary: Indicates all frames have been played and the audio finished.

member.name: E:Accord.Audio.IAudioOutput.NewFrameRequested
member.summary: Indicates the audio output is requesting a new sample.

member.name: P:Accord.Audio.IAudioOutput.IsRunning
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance is playing audio.
member.value: true if this instance is running; otherwise, false.

member.name: E:Accord.Audio.IAudioOutput.AudioOutputError
member.summary: Audio output error event.
member.remarks: This event is used to notify clients about any type of errors occurred in audio output object, for example internal exceptions.

member.name: T:Accord.Audio.ComplexSignal
member.summary: Complex audio signal. A complex discrete-time signal is any complex-valued function of the integers.

remarks.para: The class is used to keep audio signals represented in complex numbers sutable for Fourier transformations.

References:
Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Analytics Signal. Available on: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Analytic_signal

member.name: T:Accord.Audio.Signal
member.summary: Represents a PCM sound discrete signal (measured in time). A real discrete-time signal is defined as any real-valued function of the integers.

remarks.para: In signal processing, sampling is the reduction of a continuous signal to a discrete signal. A common example is the conversion of a sound wave (a continuous-time signal) to a sequence of samples (a discrete-time signal).
A sample refers to a value or set of values at a point in time and/or space.

member.name: M:Accord.Audio.Signal.#ctor(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,Accord.Audio.SampleFormat)
member.summary: Constructs a new signal.
member.param: The raw data for the signal.
The number of channels for the signal.
The sample format for the signal.
The sample date of the signal.

member.name: M:Accord.Audio.Signal.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,Accord.Audio.SampleFormat)
member.summary: Constructs a new Signal.
member.param: The number of channels for the signal.
The sample format for the signal.
The sample date of the signal.

member.name: M:Accord.Audio.Signal.GetEnergy
member.summary: Computes the signal energy.

member.name: M:Accord.Audio.Signal.GetSample(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the value of the specified sample in the Signal.
member.param: The channel's index of the sample to set.
The position of the sample to set.
member.returns: A floating-point value ranging from -1 to 1 representing the retrieved value. Conversion is performed automatically from the underlying signal sample format if supported.

member.name: M:Accord.Audio.Signal.SetSample(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the value of the specified sample in the Signal.
member.param: The channel's index of the sample to set.
The position of the sample to set.
A floating-point value ranging from -1 to 1 specifying the value to set. Conversion will be done automatically to the underlying signal sample format if supported.

member.name: T:Accord.Audio.Windows.RaisedCosineWindow
member.summary: Raised Cosine Window.

remarks.para: The "raised cosine" window is a family of temporal windows, from which the most known representative members are the Hann and Hamming windows.

References:
Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Window function. Available on: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Window_function

member.name: T:Accord.Audio.ComplexFilters.EnvelopeFilter
member.summary: Hilbert transform based envelope detector.

remarks.para: This method works by creating the analytic signal of the input by using a Hilbert transform. An analytic signal is a complex signal, where the real part is the original signal and the imaginary part is the Hilbert transform of the original signal.
The complex envelope of a signal can be found by taking the absolute (magnitude) value of the analytic signal.

member.name: M:Accord.Audio.ComplexFilters.EnvelopeFilter.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new Envelope filter.

member.name: M:Accord.Audio.ComplexFilters.EnvelopeFilter.ProcessFilter(Accord.Audio.ComplexSignal,Accord.Audio.ComplexSignal)
member.summary: Processes the filter.

member.name: T:Accord.Audio.ComplexFilters.IComplexFilterBank
member.summary: Filter banks segregates signals into different parts to be further processed. The most common filter bank is the band-pass filter bank.

member.summary: Apply filter to complex signal.
member.param: Complex signal to apply filter to.

member.summary: Apply filter to a windowed complex signal.
member.param: Windowed complex signal to apply filter to.

member.name: P:Accord.Audio.ComplexFilters.IComplexFilterBank.Length
member.summary: Number of filters in the bank.

member.name: T:Accord.Audio.SampleConverter
member.summary: Static methods to convert between different sample formats.

remarks.para: Code is mainly based on information available on the original C source code pa_converters.c from Portable Audio I/O Library.
This class try to be as fast as possible without using unsafe code.
Dither isn't currently supported. Currently supported conversions are 'to' and 'from' conversions between the following most common PCM format:

member.summary: Converts a array of signed 8-bit int samples into a array of 32-bit float-point samples.

member.name: T:Accord.Audio.IAudioSource
member.summary: Audio source interface.
member.remarks: The interface describes common methods for different type of audio sources.

member.name: M:Accord.Audio.IAudioSource.Seek(System.Int32)
member.summary: Seeks a frame.
member.remarks: This method may throw an NotSupportedException if the source does not allow repositioning.

member.name: M:Accord.Audio.IAudioSource.Start
member.summary: Start audio source.
member.remarks: Starts audio source and return execution to caller. Audio source object creates background thread and notifies about new frames with the help of event.

member.name: M:Accord.Audio.IAudioSource.SignalToStop
member.summary: Signals audio source to stop its work.
member.remarks: Signals audio source to stop its background thread, stop to provide new frames and free resources.

member.name: M:Accord.Audio.IAudioSource.WaitForStop
member.summary: Wait until audio source has stopped.
member.remarks: Waits for audio source stopping after it was signalled to stop using method.

member.name: M:Accord.Audio.IAudioSource.Stop
member.summary: Stop audio source.
member.remarks: Stops audio source aborting its thread.

member.name: E:Accord.Audio.IAudioSource.NewFrame
member.summary: New frame block event.

remarks.para: This event is used to notify clients about new available audio frame.

para.note: Since audio source may have multiple clients, each client is responsible for making a copy (cloning) of the passed audio frame, but audio source is responsible for disposing its own original copy after notifying of clients.

member.name: E:Accord.Audio.IAudioSource.AudioSourceError
member.summary: Audio source error event.
member.remarks: This event is used to notify clients about any type of errors occurred in audio source object, for example internal exceptions.

member.name: P:Accord.Audio.IAudioSource.Source
member.summary: Audio source.
member.remarks: The meaning of the property depends on particular audio source. Depending on audio source it may be a file name, driver guid, URL or any other string describing the audio source.

member.name: P:Accord.Audio.IAudioSource.DesiredFrameSize
member.summary: Amount of samples to be read on each frame.

member.name: P:Accord.Audio.IAudioSource.SampleRate
member.summary: Gets or sets the sample rate for the source.
member.remarks: Changing this property may throw an NotSupportedException if the underlying source does not allow resampling.

member.name: P:Accord.Audio.IAudioSource.CanSeek
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating if the source allows repositioning.

member.name: P:Accord.Audio.IAudioSource.FramesReceived
member.summary: Received frames count.
member.remarks: Number of frames the audio source provided from the moment of the last access to the property.

member.name: P:Accord.Audio.IAudioSource.BytesReceived
member.summary: Received bytes count.
member.remarks: Number of bytes the audio source provided from the moment of the last access to the property.

member.name: P:Accord.Audio.IAudioSource.UserData
member.summary: User data.
member.remarks: The property allows to associate user data with audio source object.

member.name: P:Accord.Audio.IAudioSource.IsRunning
member.summary: State of the audio source.
member.remarks: Current state of audio source object - running or not.
